I'd like to pass on the product. Based on the fact that none of the previous 3 buyers purchased the product after your recommendation, I'm going to assume that all 3 products were low quality. With a 50% chance of a product being high quality, the probability of all 3 being low quality is (0.5)^3 = 0.125. However, since all 3 buyers passed on the products, the probability of all 3 being low quality given that they passed is actually higher than 0.125. This suggests that the true probability of a product being low quality is higher than 0.5, and I'd rather not take the risk.
